raw_text:
Melzer shocks Agassi
 
 Second seed Andre Agassi suffered a comprehensive defeat by Jurgen Melzer in the quarter-finals of the SAP Open.
 
 Agassi was often bamboozled by the Austrian's drop shots in San Jose, losing 6-3 6-1. Defending champion and top seed Andy Roddick rallied to beat Sweden's Thomas Enqvist 3-6 7-6 (8-6) 7-5. But unseeded Cyril Saulnier beat the fourth seed Vincent Spadea 6-2 6-4 and Tommy Haas overcame eighth seed Max Mirnyi 6-7 (2-7) 7-6 (7-3) 6-2. Melzer has now beaten Agassi in two of their three meetings.
 
 "I had a good game plan and I executed it perfectly," he said. "It's always tough to come out to play Andre. "I didn't want him to play his game. He makes you run like a dog all over the court." And Agassi, who was more than matched for power by his opponent's two-handed backhand, said Melzer was an example of several players on the tour willing to take their chances against him. "A lot more guys are capable of it now," said the American. "He played much better than me. That's what he did both times. "I had opportunities to loosen myself up," Agassi added. "But I didn't convert on the big points."

Agassi lost 6-3 6-1, while other unseeded players beat top seeds Andy Roddick and Cyril Saulnier.

gemma2:2b: Andre Agassi lost to Jurgen Melzer in the SAP Open quarter-finals, 6-3 6-1.  Melzer won his second straight match against Agassi and has now beaten him twice in three meetings. Andy Roddick beat Thomas Enqvist, while Cyril Saulnier and Tommy Haas defeated Vincent Spadea and Max Mirnyi, respectively.
qwen2.5:0.5b:
Two-time Grand Slam champion Andre Agassi lost in the quarter-finals of the SAP Open against Jurgen Melzer. Melzer, one of his opponents, defeated Agassi 6-3 6-1 and won 7-5 over Enqvist. Agassi said he had a good game plan, but he felt Melzer was too tough to play. He also said Melzer was an example of players willing to take risks against him.

Note: I've tried to summarize the key points while preserving the essence of the text. If you have specific questions about the summary or need any changes in content, please let me know.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Andre Agassi defeated Jurgen Melzer in a quarter-final match at the SAP Open, despite facing challenges from his opponent's drop shots and two-handed backhand style. This was not only Melzer's first win over Agassi but also marked their second consecutive meeting. Despite losing 6-3 6-1 to Agassi initially, Roddick rallied to defeat Enqvist in a tough match. Other notable players included Saulnier beating Spadea and Haas overcoming Mirnyi. Agassi highlighted the adaptability of Melzer's game style as a player capable of challenging his opponents' playing styles.
qwen2.5:3b: Second seed Andre Agassi was defeated comprehensively by Jurgen Melzer in the quarter-finals of the SAP Open. Agassi struggled with Melzer's drop shots, losing 6-3 and 6-1. In other matches, unseeded Cyril Saulnier beat fourth seed Vincent Spadea, and Tommy Haas topped eighth seed Max Mirnyi. This was Melzer's second win against Agassi in three meetings. Melzer credited his game plan while Agassi admitted to being outplayed by his opponent's superior two-handed backhand.
opencoder:1.5b: "Melzer shocks Agassi", Melzer had a comprehensive defeat in court, by winning two of Agassi's three meetings against his opponent, and Agassi had played better than him in their respective matches.

In his first match, Melzer lost 6-3 and 7-6 to Jurgen Melzer in the first round of SAP Open. He was often bamboozled by Agassi's drop shots, but Melzer rallied to beat Sweden's Andreas Enqvist 3-6 7-6 (8-6) 7-5 in the second round.

In his second match, Melzer lost 6-2 and 7-6 to Cyril Saulnier in the second round of SAP Open. He was often bamboozled by Agassi's drop shots, but Melzer rallied to beat Sweden's Andreas Enqvist 3-6 7-6 (8-6) 7-5 in the second round.

In his third match, Melzer lost 6-2 and 7-6 to Tommy Haas in the third round of SAP Open. He was often bamboozled by Agassi's drop shots, but Melzer rallied to beat Sweden's Andreas Enqvist 3-6 7-6 (8-6) 7-5 in the second round.

In his fourth match, Melzer lost 6-2 and 7-6 to Cyril Saulnier in the third round of SAP Open. He was often bamboozled by Agassi's drop shots, but Melzer rallied to beat Sweden's Andreas Enqvist 3-6 7-6 (8-6) 7-5 in the fourth round.

In his fifth match, Melzer lost 6-2 and 7-6 to Tommy Haas in the fourth round of SAP Open. He was often bamboozled by Agassi's drop shots, but Melzer rallied to beat Sweden's Andreas Enqvist 3-6 7-6 (8-6) 7-5 in the fifth round.

tinyllama:1.1b: Melzer shocked Agassi in the quarter-finals of the SAP Open, defeating the World No. 2 in a four-set match that lasted more than three hours. Despite being outplayed by the defending champion and top seed Andy Roddick, Melzer employed a solid game plan and executed it perfectly to defeat Agassi in two rounds of the event. Meanwhile, the second seed was overmatched and fell prey to Melzer's power game, with both players demonstrating an ability to take advantage of opposing strategies against their chances.
tinydolphin:1.1b: The SAP Open quarter-final match between Andre Agassi and Jurgen Melzer saw a surprisingly dominant display by Austrian Jürgen Melzer, who defeated world number two Andre Agassi in an impressive victory. Despite being outgunned on the court by his opponent's powerful backhand, Agassi was unable to mount a convincing resistance against Melzer. The match took place at the SAP Open, held at the Stanford University Gym in Stanford, California.
